items.sentence: Tom's dog scratches the door whenever he wants to go out.
Tom pretended not to notice that Mary was staring at him.

When did you first notice that you were losing your hair?

I can't tell red and green apart because I'm color-blind.
Being loved is perhaps the greatest feeling in the world.

It wasn't until daybreak that I was able to get to sleep.
Tom accidentally put salt in his coffee instead of sugar.
That movie wasn't as interesting as Tom said it would be.
Let's not forget what happened when Tom tried to do that.
Tom was the only one that knew what had happened to Mary.
Tom was dating a girl named Mary the last time I met him.
Tom told me that he thought that Mary would be surprised.
Tom told me that he thought that Mary was being truthful.
Tom told me that he thought that Mary had been impressed.
Tom told me that he thought that he was losing his sight.
Tom told me that he wouldn't be able to be here tomorrow.
Tom told me that he wasn't planning on staying very long.
Tom told me that he was interested in visiting Australia.
Tom told me that he was going to try to find another job.
Tom told me that he didn't have to be at today's meeting.
Tom told me that he didn't have enough money to buy that.
I don't think Tom is as crazy as some people think he is.

I don't think Tom knows what time the meeting will start.
I don't think Tom knows what kind of shoes he should buy.

I don't think you need to tell Tom what Mary plans to do.
I don't think we should tell Tom what Mary did yesterday.
I suspect that Tom went to Boston last weekend with Mary.

I suspect Tom won't tell Mary she needs to do that today.
